BioStat | R package
  • Functions

Normality tests with formula interface

Perform Shapiro-Wilk (default), Lilliefors (Kolmogorov-Smirnov), Anderson_darling and other tests of normality.

test_normality(x, data = NULL, test = "Shapiro-Wilk", ..., groups = NULL,
  sep = " | ", prettify = FALSE)

# S3 method for test_normality
print(x, ..., rm_col_method = TRUE)

# S3 method for test_normality
pander(x, ..., caption = NA, rm_col_method = TRUE)

Arguments

x

Either a formula, a numeric vector or a name of a vector in data. If x is a formula (e.g. variable ~ factor), left-hand side provides variable to be summarized. Right-hand side and condition describe subsets. If the left-hand side is empty, right-hand side and condition are shifted over as a convenience.
data

A data frame that contains the variables mentioned in x.
test

(string | function) Either a string (case insensitive, may be unambiguously abbreviated) with a name of nomality test or a function, which carries out the test. Possible names of tests:

  • "SW", "Shapiro-Wilk" � for Shapiro-Wilk test;

  • "Lilliefors" � for Kolmogorov-Smirnov test wtih Lilliefor's correction;

  • "AD", "Anderson-Darling" � for Anderson-Darling test;

  • "CVM", "CM", "Cramer-von Mises" � for Cramer-von Mises test;

  • "SF", "Shapiro-Francia" � for Shapiro-Francia test;

  • "Chi-squared","Pearsons" � for Pearson's chi-squared test of normality.
...

Parameters to be passed to the main function (defined/selected in fun) that carries out a normality test.
groups

grouping variable that will be folded into the formula (if there is room for it). This offers some additional flexibility in how formulas can be specified.
sep

(not used yet)
prettify

(logical) Should functions format_numbers and prettify_p_column be applied on the output of the function?
rm_col_method

(logical) If TRUE column "method" is not printed.
caption

(string|NULL|NA) A caption for the table with results of a normality test. If NA � a default caption is printed (default). If NULL � no caption is printed.

Value

A data frame with normality test results for each group.

Details

By default, methods print.test_normality and pander.test_normality do not print column called "method".

See also

Package nortest

Examples

library(BioStat)
library(pander)
data(CO2)

test_normality(uptake ~ Treatment, data = CO2, prettify = TRUE)
#> 
#>  The results of Shapiro-Wilk normality test 
#> 
#>    Treatment statistic p.value
#> 1 nonchilled     0.945   0.04 
#> 2    chilled     0.898  <0.01 

rez <- test_normality(uptake ~ Type + Treatment,
                      data = CO2)
rez
#> 
#>  The results of Shapiro-Wilk normality test 
#> 
#>           Type.Treatment statistic     p.value
#> 1      Quebec.nonchilled 0.8252592 0.001639137
#> 2 Mississippi.nonchilled 0.8551907 0.005225759
#> 3         Quebec.chilled 0.8529291 0.004773047
#> 4    Mississippi.chilled 0.9481933 0.314741370

rez2 <- test_normality(uptake ~ Type + Treatment,
                       data = CO2,
                       test = "chi-sq")
rez2
#> 
#>  The results of Pearson chi-square normality test 
#> 
#>           Type.Treatment statistic     p.value n.classes df
#> 1      Quebec.nonchilled 13.333333 0.009756859         7  4
#> 2 Mississippi.nonchilled 10.000000 0.040427682         7  4
#> 3         Quebec.chilled 13.333333 0.009756859         7  4
#> 4    Mississippi.chilled  5.333333 0.254772654         7  4

# Round to 3 decimal digits (all columns):
format_numbers(rez, 3)
#> 
#>  The results of Shapiro-Wilk normality test 
#> 
#>           Type.Treatment statistic p.value
#> 1      Quebec.nonchilled     0.825   0.002
#> 2 Mississippi.nonchilled     0.855   0.005
#> 3         Quebec.chilled     0.853   0.005
#> 4    Mississippi.chilled     0.948   0.315

# Round to 3 significant digits (all columns):
format_numbers(rez, 3, format = "g")
#> 
#>  The results of Shapiro-Wilk normality test 
#> 
#>           Type.Treatment statistic p.value
#> 1      Quebec.nonchilled     0.825 0.00164
#> 2 Mississippi.nonchilled     0.855 0.00523
#> 3         Quebec.chilled     0.853 0.00477
#> 4    Mississippi.chilled     0.948   0.315

# Prettify the column with p-values
prettify_p_column(rez)
#> 
#>  The results of Shapiro-Wilk normality test 
#> 
#>           Type.Treatment statistic p.value
#> 1      Quebec.nonchilled 0.8252592  <0.01 
#> 2 Mississippi.nonchilled 0.8551907  <0.01 
#> 3         Quebec.chilled 0.8529291  <0.01 
#> 4    Mississippi.chilled 0.9481933   0.31 

# Print as a 'pandoc' table
pander(rez)
#> 
#> --------------------------------------------
#>     Type.Treatment      statistic   p.value 
#> ---------------------- ----------- ---------
#>   Quebec.nonchilled      0.8253    0.001639 
#> 
#> Mississippi.nonchilled   0.8552    0.005226 
#> 
#>     Quebec.chilled       0.8529    0.004773 
#> 
#>  Mississippi.chilled     0.9482     0.3147  
#> --------------------------------------------
#> 
#> Table: The results of Shapiro-Wilk normality test.
#> 

# Other output possibilities
rez %>% format_numbers(3)
#> 
#>  The results of Shapiro-Wilk normality test 
#> 
#>           Type.Treatment statistic p.value
#> 1      Quebec.nonchilled     0.825   0.002
#> 2 Mississippi.nonchilled     0.855   0.005
#> 3         Quebec.chilled     0.853   0.005
#> 4    Mississippi.chilled     0.948   0.315

rez %>%
   format_numbers(3) %>%
   pander()
#> 
#> --------------------------------------------
#>     Type.Treatment      statistic   p.value 
#> ---------------------- ----------- ---------
#>   Quebec.nonchilled       0.825      0.002  
#> 
#> Mississippi.nonchilled    0.855      0.005  
#> 
#>     Quebec.chilled        0.853      0.005  
#> 
#>  Mississippi.chilled      0.948      0.315  
#> --------------------------------------------
#> 
#> Table: The results of Shapiro-Wilk normality test.
#> 

rez %>%
    format_numbers(3, "g") %>%
    prettify_p_column() %>%
    pander()
#> 
#> --------------------------------------------
#>     Type.Treatment      statistic   p.value 
#> ---------------------- ----------- ---------
#>   Quebec.nonchilled       0.825      <0.01  
#> 
#> Mississippi.nonchilled    0.855      <0.01  
#> 
#>     Quebec.chilled        0.853      <0.01  
#> 
#>  Mississippi.chilled      0.948      0.32   
#> --------------------------------------------
#> 
#> Table: The results of Shapiro-Wilk normality test.
#>
